commands.description: add a webhook to an app
commands.help:
Usage: heroku webhooks:add [flags]

add a webhook to an app

Flags:
 -a, --app APP                      app to run command against
 -i, --include INCLUDE              comma delimited event types your server will
                                    receive
 -l, --level LEVEL                  notify does not retry, sync will retry until
                                    successful or timeout
 -r, --remote REMOTE                git remote of app to use
 -s, --secret SECRET                value to sign delivery with in
                                    Heroku-Webhook-Hmac-SHA256 header
 -t, --authorization AUTHORIZATION  authoriation header to send with webhooks
 -u, --url URL                      URL for receiver

Example:

 $ heroku webhooks:add -i api:dyno -l notify -u https://example.com/hooks
helpLine: add a webhook to an app

commands.help:
Usage: heroku webhooks [flags]

list webhooks on an app

Flags:
 -a, --app APP        app to run command against
 -r, --remote REMOTE  git remote of app to use

Example:

 $ heroku webhooks

commands.description: info for a webhook on an app
commands.help:
Usage: heroku webhooks:info ID [flags]

info for a webhook on an app

Flags:
 -a, --app APP        app to run command against
 -r, --remote REMOTE  git remote of app to use

Example:

 $ heroku webhooks:info 99999999-9999-9999-9999-999999999999
helpLine: info for a webhook on an app

commands.description: removes a webhook from an app
commands.help:
Usage: heroku webhooks:remove ID [flags]

removes a webhook from an app

ID  id of webhook to remove

Flags:
 -a, --app APP        app to run command against
 -r, --remote REMOTE  git remote of app to use

Example:

 $ heroku webhooks:remove 99999999-9999-9999-9999-999999999999
helpLine: removes a webhook from an app

commands.description: updates a webhook in an app
commands.help:
Usage: heroku webhooks:update ID [flags]

updates a webhook in an app

ID  id of webhook to remove

Flags:
 -a, --app APP          app to run command against
 -i, --include INCLUDE  comma delimited webhook types
 -l, --level LEVEL      webhook notification level
 -r, --remote REMOTE    git remote of app to use
 -s, --secret SECRET    comma delimited hook types
 -u, --url URL          url to send webhook to

Example:

 $ heroku webhooks:update 99999999-9999-9999-9999-999999999999 -i dyno -l notify -s 09928c40bf1b191b645174a19f7053d16a180da37332e719ef0998f4c0a2 -u https://example.com/hooks
helpLine: updates a webhook in an app
